subject: Re: A shipment from order #SSN2328 is on the way
description_text:
Good afternoon,

I would like to return this as it is not plug and play. I’ve contacted your
support department and they have advised me that there is a known issue
with the rig set up I have which means I need to purchase additional
components to stop the emi.

Please can you send me a shipping label?

Thanks

Steve

conversations.body_text: Hi Steve Forrester,    Please provide your previous ticket number. Regarding the electromagnetic interference you reported, this is not an issue with the pedals themselves. It is mainly caused by interference from other Fanatec bases, or due to your home PC not using a three-prong socket with proper grounding, which results in poor or non-standard grounding. Our pedals have been thoroughly tested and confirmed to have no such issues.  If you test the pedals with the base turned off, they will function normally. This is why we have suggested solutions that have already been verified by other customers. In fact, we recommend having an electrician check whether your PC and base are properly grounded, as this is the root cause of the problem. Without proper grounding, static electricity may frequently build up in winter, affecting your PC and other racing USB devices. In our own tests with the Fanatec CLS DD 8Nm base, we also found that reliable grounding is essential. In addition, the issue may also be related to unstable USB power supply. We recommend connecting the pedals to the rear USB 3.0 port of your PC, and avoiding USB hubs without independent power supply.  Please note that insufficient grounding not only affects device stability, but also poses electrical safety risks. In extreme cases, electrical leakage could cause personal injury.  Based on the above, we can confirm that the device itself has no issues, so we do not recommend a return. We will continue to assist you in troubleshooting your setup to ensure safe and stable operation.

Hello,

Thank you for your reply. I am disappointed that you recommend me hiring an
electrician to resolve this issue. On the web site the pedals were
described as ‘plug and play’ and this is clearly not the case. Furthermore,
you knew about the issue with the base I have but did not mention this
anywhere prior to purchase. If I knew about this before I would not have
purchased them, and I feel I have been mis-sold this product and would like
a refund. Please can you send me a shipping label?

Thanks,

Steve

On Fri, 22 Aug 2025 at 05:49, service@simsonn.com

Hello,

I have not received a reply, please can you confirm how I should return
this to you?

Thanks

Steve

> On Fri, 22 Aug 2025 at 05:49, service@simsonn.com
Hello, we're here to assist you with any questions you may have. However, we cannot accept returns for undamaged products. Thank you for your understanding!

Hello,

I have been mis-sold this product and would like a refund. It was
advertised as plug and play when it is clearly not if used with certain
wheelbases which you knew about but did not put this information on your
website.

Thanks

Steve


On Fri, 29 Aug 2025 at 12:36, service@simsonn.com

Hello, we promote our plug-and-play functionality because we have factory-calibrated the settings, enabling basic operation immediately upon connection. Additionally, we are unable to list other brands or product models on our website without prior authorisation. Please trust our support team; I shall instruct them to prioritise resolving your issue. With your cooperation, the matter should be swiftly addressed. Thank you for your understanding.

Hi Steve Forrester,      I have reviewed your email again, but I did not find any detailed description of the issue you mentioned earlier. Your feedback is too vague—you only mentioned “interference” without explaining the actual symptoms, and no video or picture was provided. Could you please clarify what exactly is happening?  From a design perspective, the Pro X Ultra should not be affected by the Fanatec base. Therefore, I need you to provide more details, such as a video, pictures, or a clear description of the situation, so that I can accurately assess the problem and assist you in resolving it.  In addition, this issue does not require an electrician. The key point is that the “interference” you mentioned needs to be described more clearly, as it may not even be caused by interference at all.

Hello,

Please see an example of in game footage. The brake pedal is not pressed
but it is being recognised as being on full. (Red brake level indicator on
left). Please let me know ow how to resolve this?

Thanks,

Steve

On Sat, 30 Aug 2025 at 05:01, service@simsonn.com

Hi Steve Forrester,     Please download and install version 2.1.1 of the software, then unplug and reconnect the USB cable. Next, use the Offset function to adjust the initial signal of the pedals. This step is usually necessary if you have changed or adjusted the mechanical structure or damping. After making these adjustments, please recalibrate the pedals.  Once the software test confirms everything is working properly, you can then enter the game and bind the controls. Additionally, you may go to Settings → Update to update the firmware. After the update is complete, unplug and reconnect the USB cable again.  Lastly, please let us know which game you are testing. In theory, our pedals are fully compatible with all major games, so there should be no compatibility issues.    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mS9dS2GyzhRYo81BcmTIOXY1POa6RvST/view?usp=drive_link

Hello,

We have the latest version of the firmware, have re-calibrated but still
have the issue. The game is Le Mans Ultimate.

Thanks,

Steve

On Wed, 3 Sept 2025 at 05:45, service@simsonn.com

Hello,

I have not heard from you so I would like to as previously requested return
the item to you. Please can you let me know how I can do this?

Thanks,

Steve

Steve


On Sun, 7 Sep 2025 at 04:08, service@simsonn.com

Hi Steve Forrester,    Please provide a video clearly showing the interference issue, so we can review and analyze the cause.  At the moment, your description is still unclear and does not specify the exact type of interference, making it difficult for us to accurately troubleshoot the problem.

Hello,

We are getting nowhere. At the start you informed us it was caused by
interference and let us know we had to complete several steps and purchase
additional parts to make it work. You then said we would need to hire an
electrician to make it work. Following this you said it was not caused by
interference and gave us several steps to make it work which we have done
and it still does not work.

So 3 weeks in and a “plug and play”
Item still does not work, so we wish to return the item for a refund.

Please let me know how we can return this for a refund?

Thanks

Steve

On Sun, 7 Sep 2025 at 08:08, service@simsonn.com

Hi Steve Forrester,    Previously, you didn’t provide any information, photos, or videos related to the interference issue, so we weren’t able to identify the cause.  If you can now share a video and some detailed photos showing the interference, we’ll analyze them right away and get back to you with a solution as soon as possible.
